cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 430 mi ESE of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: moving westward tonight, then turning northwest and north-northwest; forecast to pass south of Jamaica Sunday, approach the Cayman Islands late Sundayâ€“early Monday, move over or near western Cuba Monday night, then track northward in the east-central Gulf toward the Florida Gulf Coast mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Gulf Coast (around the Tampa Bay vicinity)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for Cayman Islands; Tropical Storm Watch for Jamaica
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and western Caribbean, Cayman Islands, western Cuba, Florida Gulf Coast, portions of the Florida Peninsula
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible but uncertain (limited urban flood risk noted)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are possible mid-week with peak 34-kt probability ~37%
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge currently forecast for the southeast Florida Atlantic coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could begin Monday; totals may approach 4 inches with localized flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough surf mid-week
